intro: Dicliptera capitata, commonly known as the clustered grass or African grass, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, two-lipped flowers arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions. Dicliptera capitata is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can be found in savannas and grasslands.
